paper_metadata.title: Social Entrepreneurship Program (SEP) as a sustainable business model for financial inclusion

program_information.region: West Bandung Regency, Majalengka Regency, Bantul Regency, Semarang Regency, and Jakarta City

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: This program provides cash assistance to families registered in the poverty program data

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: The research results show that SEP has a good impact on beneficiary income. This program has succeeded in increasing the capacity of beneficiaries to manage businesses and expanding financial access inclusively.
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: The research method used is a mixture of quantitative and qualitative.

bonus_information.qualitative_evidence_citation: Meanwhile, program input will be seen qualitatively from the program manager.

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: This chapter explores the Social Entrepreneurship Program (SEP) as a sustainable business model to achieve financial inclusion for low-income families.
evidence_citations.country_citation: One of the poverty alleviation programs in Indonesia is CCT.
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: The SEP launch targets families receiving conditional cash transfer (CCT) to increase income.
